citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Durham, NC - Tree Cover Configuration and Connectivity

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research and Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract: This EnviroAtlas dataset categorizes forest land cover into structural elements (e.g. core, edge, connector, etc.). REPLACE-MF Water was considered background (value 129) during the analysis to create this dataset, however it has been converted into value 10 to distinguish it from land area background. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: This dataset is useful for green infrastructure applications, such as habitat suitability analyses. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://epa.gov/geospatial/policies.html

enttyp.enttypd: MSPA Landscape Elements with Water as Background

attr.attrdef: Values and Labels for GUIDOS v. 2.1 MSPA

edom.edomvd: Connected at one end to Edge, Perforation, Bridge, or Loop
Disjoint foreground object and too small to contain Core
Area analyzed as background but classified as water set apart to distinguish land vs water background area
Interior foreground area excluding foreground perimeter
Connected at more than one end to different Core areas
Edge area connected at more than one end to different core areas
Perforation connected at more than one end to different core areas
Connected at more than one end to the same Core area
Edge area connected at more than one end to the same core area
Perforation connected at more than one end to the same core area

overview.eaover:
For more information on GUIDOS (Graphical User Interface for the Description of image Objects and their Shapes) v2.1 MSPA (Morphological Spatial Pattern Analysis) Standalone Tool please visit: http://forest.jrc.ec.europa.eu/download/software/guidos/mspa/
A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps.
